intro: Hermbstaedtia scabra, commonly known as the rough hermbstaedtia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and lobed leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Hermbstaedtia scabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
